title.value: Recovering Dantzig-Wolfe Bounds by Cutting Planes
title.justification: The title of the paper as specified in the provided text is clearly stated.
title.quote: Recovering Dantzig-Wolfe Bounds by Cutting Planes

extractions.description: The paper investigates cutting planes derived from the Dantzig-Wolfe (DW) decomposition algorithm in mixed-integer programming (MIP). It demonstrates that these cuts can provide the same dual bounds as DW decomposition while incorporating them into the original formulation to potentially improve computational performance. The paper includes discussions on strengthening these cuts and presents computational results on specific problems.

type.justification: The focus of the paper is on developing a theoretical approach to generate cutting planes from DW decomposition and demonstrating their effectiveness through computational studies.
type.quote: We investigate cutting planes that can be derived using the DW decomposition algorithm and show that these cuts can provide the same dual bounds as DW decomposition.

name.justification: The paper is primarily focused on mixed-integer programming and decomposition techniques, which are core topics in operations research.
name.quote: Dantzig-Wolfe (DW) decomposition is a well-known technique in mixed-integer programming (MIP) for decomposing and convexifying constraints to obtain potentially strong dual bounds.

name.justification: The paper directly addresses methods within mixed-integer programming, particularly through Dantzig-Wolfe decomposition and cutting planes.
name.quote: Dantzig-Wolfe (DW) decomposition is a well-known technique in mixed-integer programming (MIP) for decomposing and convexifying constraints to obtain potentially strong dual bounds.

name.justification: The paper explicitly tests the proposed approach on the Multiple Knapsack Assignment Problem.
name.quote: We test our approach on the Multiple Knapsack Assignment Problem...

referenced_paper_title.value: Upper and lower bounding procedures for the multiple knapsack assignment problem
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper for this dataset provides a detailed description and context of the problem.
referenced_paper_title.quote: [38] Kataoka, S., & Yamada, T. (2014). Upper and lower bounding procedures for the multiple knapsack assignment problem.

name.justification: The paper explicitly tests the proposed approach on the Temporal Knapsack Problem as well.
name.quote: We test our approach on the Multiple Knapsack Assignment Problem and the Temporal Knapsack Problem, and show that the proposed cuts are helpful in accelerating the solution time.

referenced_paper_title.value: Uncommon Dantzig-Wolfe reformulation for the temporal knapsack problem
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper for this dataset provides a detailed description and the uncommon Dantzig-Wolfe reformulation used.
referenced_paper_title.quote: [25] Caprara, A., Furini, F., & Malaguti, E. (2013). Uncommon Dantzig-Wolfe reformulation for the temporal knapsack problem.

name.justification: Gurobi is explicitly mentioned as an optimization solver used for solving various LP and MIP problems in the experiments.
name.quote: All optimization problems are solved using the optimization solver Gurobi with version 9.5.0 for MKAP and version 10.0.2 for TKP.
